preqs: A major sequence in Archaeology and Ancient History

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course type {09, 09-1, 09-4}

description: This unit examines a variety of methodological approaches to studying the ancient classical world: Greece, the Hellenistic kingdoms and Rome. Categories of data studied include: historiography, numismatic, epigraphic, papyrological, and material remains. The unit is organised around a series of case studies; these include aspects of Athens under Peisistratos, Alexander the Great's death and burial, and Christians in Rome  under Nero.
